title: Please help ID this
content:
I am stuck with this one! Anyone have any ideas?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223754/http:/typophile.com/files/type_45.jpg) | 15.39 KB |
author: feldhouse

comments.content:
This is Optima from Linotype:  
 [http://www.linotype.com/searchresult?q=optima](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223754/http:/www.linotype.com/searchresult?q=optima "http://www.linotype.com/searchresult?q=optima")

This is also a standard system font included with Mac OS X.

Mikey :-)
I thought the same, however, when you have capital letters, Optima has a slight curve in letters like L, I, N. This one has straight stems at 90 degree angles.

The difference is most likely a product of image compression.

Also have a gander at Optima Nova:  
 [http://www.linotype.com/54142/optimanova-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223754/http:/www.linotype.com/54142/optimanova-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/54142/optimanova-family.html")

Mikey :-)
Could be the Bitstream version: [Zapf Humanist 601](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014223754/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/zapf-humanist-601/).
